title: Time Complexity Basics
subject: Algorithms
theory:
Time Complexity is NOT measuring seconds. It measures **how the number of operations grows** as input Size `n` increases. 
- Loop running `n` times -> linear growth.
- Nested loop -> quadratic growth.

examples.explanation: If n=10, 10 ops. If n=1000, 1000 ops. Linear.

common_mistakes.correction: A supercomputer running an O(n^2) algo will eventually be beaten by a phone running O(n) as n grows.

summary: Efficiency matters more than hardware speed.
